grammarNote.title: Desire: たい
grammarNote.explanation: To express wanting to do something, replace the verb's ます-stem ending with たい: 食べる→食べたい (want to eat), いく→いきたい (want to go). たい conjugates like an い-adjective: 食べたかった (wanted to eat), 食べたくない (don't want to eat). Note: たい expresses the speaker's own desire. For others' desires, Japanese uses different constructions.
